name: SPDR S&P Semiconductor ETF
description: The SPDR S&P Semiconductor ETF (XSD) is an exchange-traded fund that seeks to provide investment results that correspond to the total return performance of the S&P Semiconductor Select Industry Index. This ETF was designed to track the performance of companies in the semiconductor sector, which is critical to the technology industry and is known for its rapid growth and innovation. The semiconductor industry plays a vital role in powering electronics and modern technology, including computers, smartphones, and other digital devices. XSD offers investors exposure to a diverse range of semiconductor companies, from large established players to smaller emerging firms. The fund is structured to provide a way for investors to gain broad exposure to the semiconductor sector without needing to pick individual stocks. Its holdings include a variety of companies engaged in the design, distribution, manufacture, and sale of semiconductors. As the demand for advanced technology continues to increase globally, the semiconductor industry is expected to remain a key driver of economic growth and innovation. With its focus on this dynamic industry, XSD serves as a strategic investment option for those looking to capitalize on the ongoing digital transformation and technological advancements.

seo.meta_title: SPDR S&P Semiconductor ETF (XSD) | Invest in Semiconductor Companies
seo.meta_description: Explore the SPDR S&P Semiconductor ETF (XSD), designed to track the performance of the semiconductor sector. Invest in leading companies driving technological innovation.

faq.question: What is XSD?
faq.answer: XSD is an exchange-traded fund that tracks the performance of the S&P Semiconductor Select Industry Index.

faq.question: Who manages XSD?
faq.answer: XSD is managed by State Street Global Advisors.

faq.question: What types of companies are in XSD?
faq.answer: XSD includes a variety of semiconductor companies involved in the design, manufacture, and sale of semiconductors.
